Brief Hospital Course: She was admitted to [**Hospital1 18**] on [**2141-8-16**] for a "Whipple Procedure".
Pain: She had an epidural for pain control. She had an excellent pain level and the epidural remained in place for 4 days. She was then switched to a PCA and eventually switched to PO Percocet with good pain control.
GI: She was NPO with a NGT and IV fluids. The NGT was removed POD 3 and she was started on sips POD 4. Her diet was advanced slowly as she had return of bowel function. She was noted to have some loose bowel movements x 3 on POD 5. These resolved in a day. On POD 6, a JP amylase was 44 and her drain was D/C'd POD 7. The staples were D/C'd on POD 8. There were no sign of redness or infection.
Renal: She had low urine output post-operatively and she received a 500 cc bolus of LR. A U/S of her kidneys was unremarkable and showed no hydronephrosis. She did not respond to the bolus and continued to be oliguric. She was transferred to the SICU for further monitoring. POD 2, her urine output began to improve and her creatinine remained low.
Heme/ID: She was noted to have a temperature of 101.1 on POD 2. Blood cultures and urine cultures were negative. Her temperature improved with hydration.
Neuro: The patient fell while getting out of bed. She felt "dizzy" upon waking. She is alert and oriented to person, place, month, President, and not year. She had no signs of head trauma, or fractures.
Physical Therapy: She was seen several times and cleared by PT to go home.
Medications on Admission: nifedipine SR 30qd; lisinopril 30qd; lopressor 12.5BID
Discharge Medications: 1. Acetaminophen-Codeine 300-30 mg Tablet Sig: 1-2 Tablets PO Q4H (every 4 hours) as needed for pain. Disp:*40 Tablet(s)* Refills:*0* 2. Discharge Disposition: Home
Discharge Diagnosis: Periampullary Cancer Incisional Hernia Repair
Discharge Condition: Good
Discharge Instructions: * Increasing pain * Fever (>101.5 F) * Inability to eat or persistent vomiting * Inability to pass gas or stool * Other symptoms concerning to you
You may resume your normal home medications and take all new medications as ordered.
You may shower and wash incision with soap and water. Pat area dry. Leave open to air. The steri strips will fall off on their own.
Monitor your incision for redness, swelling, or discharge. No lifting >10 lbs for 4 weeks. Walk several times every day and increase activity as tolerated.
